title: YWAM, Evangelicals, Deconstruction, Estuary, and the U-Shaped Story
description:
Jess is back for another chat. Estuary talk ignited his imagination because of his story. We've spoken before links below. We go deep into what churches get wrong and why estuaries could help churches with their mission of blessing the world. 



Notes. 

What are reasons the church should get onboard with something like this

Framed it in evangelism terms

Deconstruction phase

Parents got saved when he was 8, parents started doing missions work with YWAM

Getting crowds so that someone can preach to them

All non-denominational, very evangelical flavor, 

Bible centered, spirit led active Christian ministry

Estuary

Came to a breaking point where God wasn't telling me what to do

"Tell me what to do God!"

First step of a cascade down to deconstruction valley, early 2000s, he's 40 years old now

So much emphasis about certainty of belief and holding on to faith no matter what. Suppress all doubts to try to steal any certainty you have about faith. 

When he was deconstruction he felt like God sort of let him go. There was a specific moment. 

In a way God was letting me go. 

I wasn't going to have the security I was going to have by Him telling him what to do. 

That was the moment when God kind of like let him go. 

Followed the postmodern stuff that was going on. 

Found Peter Rollins. Peter Rollins as the ferryman that got him across the marshlands.

He's a theist of some kind. Held onto just God and everything else could go if it needed to. 

Married and three boys. 

Outside he's going to church. All of this is internal

Having to deal with these issues on online spaces. Not a lot of people face to face to talk with. 

Trying to get into Biologos, trying to bridge that divide

Right when social justice is getting stirred up. It was a part of the conversation since he was a teenager. 

YWAM missiology trying not to transmit culture with the gospel

Get down to the core of the gospel without the American nationalist trapping and the colonialist trappings…

Was Paul's additions to the New Testament actually good. Maybe we just need to stick with the gospel. Get to the historical Jesus. What if there's no hell? Why do we have this doctrine? 

Rob Bell, going down the path with the Liturgists. 

Peter Rollins ferries me across. Then I have to find something. 

Few years before he ran into JBP. JBP melded the scientific and religious. 

I had two worlds in my head and JBP melded them. 

Jonathan Pageau

Deconstructing Christian materialism

Similar to how YWAM operates. Started out of the Jesus movement by Loren Cunningham

Started buying property to run schools to listen to God and go do what he says. 

They would raise up leaders and they would send them out. 

Buy up a property and start their own YWAM base. 

Some bases will get cult like

Caught more than taught

The U-shaped journey is inevitable

People who haven't taken the post-modern dump yet

Don't think alone

The U Shaped Story

How do you start one now? 



My first talk with Jess where he tells his story. https://youtu.be/SNfv51SVB0k


My conversations with Jess in a playlist https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLYSXopxC8Z9vxoSXlLYP1bTq5Sf0zt6nJ
